Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Division's decision that the applicant was not a Convention refugee and lacked a credible basis for his claim is correct
Application_Facts: The applicant provided testimony and documentary evidence about political persecution in Cameroon due to his father's political activities
Decision_Outcome: The court found the Refugee Division erred in law by not properly analyzing all evidence and applying subsection 69.1(9.1)
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review application filed challenging the Refugee Division's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed, original decision quashed, and case referred back for re-hearing
Defendant_Behavior: Refugee Division dismissed applicant's testimony as not credible and failed to adequately assess objective evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Political persecution in Cameroon due to father's political activities
Legal_Standard: Credible evidence supporting refugee status under subsection 69.1(9.1)
Review_Standard: Standard of correctness for questions of law
Credibility_Assessment: Refugee Division dismissed applicant's testimony as not credible
Evidence_Used: Personal testimony, documents related to political persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Testimony and documentary evidence on political persecution
Governing_Rule: Subsection 69.1(9.1) requires assessment of credible evidence for refugee status
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to adequately assess objective evidence
Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for new hearing
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to political persecution in Cameroon
Cause_Description: Applicant's claim for refugee status was rejected due to perceived lack of credibility and insufficient evidence
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient analysis of objective evidence by Refugee Division
Evidence_Issues: Credibility of testimony, adequacy of documentary evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and inadequate evaluation of both subjective and objective evidence
Decision_Rationale: Error in law due to failure to properly apply evidentiary requirements under subsection 69.1(9.1)
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of thorough credibility assessment and insufficient consideration of corroborating evidence
